sn35.30:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the practice fit for uprooting all conceiving.
sn35.30:1.1.comm: “Conceiving” is thinking in terms of self. This is discussed in detail in MN 1, the phrasing of which is echoed here.

sn35.30:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmīti.
sn35.30:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak. …

sn35.30:1.3.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasāruppā paṭipadā?
sn35.30:1.3.eng: And what is the practice fit for uprooting all conceiving?

sn35.30:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhuṃ na maññati, cakkhusmiṃ na maññati, cakkhuto na maññati, cakkhuṃ meti na maññati.
sn35.30:1.4.eng: It’s when a mendicant does not conceive anything to be the eye, does not conceive it in the eye, does not conceive it as the eye, and does not conceive that ‘the eye is mine.’

sn35.30:1.5.pli: Rūpe na maññati, rūpesu na maññati, rūpato na maññati, rūpā meti na maññati.
sn35.30:1.5.eng: They don’t conceive anything to be sights, they don’t conceive it in sights, they don’t conceive it as sights, and they don’t conceive that ‘sights are mine.’

sn35.30:1.6.pli: Cakkhuviññāṇaṃ na maññati, cakkhuviññāṇasmiṃ na maññati, cakkhuviññāṇato na maññati, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ meti na maññati.

sn35.30:1.7.pli: Cakkhusamphassaṃ na maññati, cakkhusamphassasmiṃ na maññati, cakkhusamphassato na maññati, cakkhusamphasso meti na maññati.

sn35.30:1.8.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati …pe…
sn35.30:1.8.eng: They don’t conceive anything to be the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on eye contact. They don’t conceive it in that, they don’t conceive it as that, and they don’t conceive that ‘that is mine.’

sn35.30:1.9.pli: jivhaṃ na maññati, jivhāya na maññati, jivhāto na maññati, jivhā meti na maññati.
sn35.30:1.9.eng: They don’t conceive anything to be the ear … nose … tongue …

sn35.30:1.10.pli: Rase na maññati, rasesu na maññati, rasato na maññati, rasā meti na maññati.

sn35.30:1.11.pli: Jivhāviññāṇaṃ na maññati, jivhāviññāṇasmiṃ na maññati, jivhāviññāṇato na maññati, jivhāviññāṇaṃ meti na maññati.

sn35.30:1.12.pli: Jivhāsamphassaṃ na maññati, jivhāsamphassasmiṃ na maññati, jivhāsamphassato na maññati, jivhāsamphasso meti na maññati.

sn35.30:1.13.pli: Yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati …pe…

sn35.30:1.14.pli: manaṃ na maññati, manasmiṃ na maññati, manato na maññati, mano meti na maññati.

sn35.30:1.15.pli: Dhamme na maññati, dhammesu na maññati, dhammato na maññati, dhammā meti na maññati.

sn35.30:1.16.pli: Manoviññāṇaṃ na maññati, manoviññāṇasmiṃ na maññati, manoviññāṇato na maññati, manoviññāṇaṃ meti na maññati.

sn35.30:1.17.pli: Manosamphassaṃ na maññati, manosamphassasmiṃ na maññati, manosamphassato na maññati, manosamphasso meti na maññati.

sn35.30:1.18.pli: Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati.
sn35.30:1.18.eng: They don’t conceive anything to be the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on mind contact. They don’t conceive it in that, they don’t conceive it as that, and they don’t conceive that ‘that is mine.’

sn35.30:1.19.pli: Sabbaṃ na maññati, sabbasmiṃ na maññati, sabbato na maññati, sabbaṃ meti na maññati.
sn35.30:1.19.eng: They don’t conceive anything to be all, they don’t conceive it in all, they don’t conceive it as all, and they don’t conceive that ‘all is mine.’

sn35.30:1.20.pli: So evaṃ amaññamāno na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.
sn35.30:1.20.eng: Not conceiving, they don’t grasp at anything in the world.

sn35.30:1.21.pli: Anupādiyaṃ na paritassati. Aparitassaṃ paccattaññeva parinibbāyati.
sn35.30:1.21.eng: Not grasping, they’re not anxious. Not being anxious, they personally become extinguished.

sn35.30:1.22.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
sn35.30:1.22.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’

sn35.30:1.23.pli: Ayaṃ kho sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasāruppā paṭipadā”ti.
sn35.30:1.23.eng: This is the practice fit for uprooting all conceiving.”

sn35.31:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all conceiving.
sn35.31:1.1.comm: “Conducive to” (sappāya) is a synonym of “fit for” (sāruppa) in the previous discourse.

sn35.31:1.3.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā?
sn35.31:1.3.eng: And what is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all conceiving?

sn35.31:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhuṃ na maññati, cakkhusmiṃ na maññati, cakkhuto na maññati, cakkhuṃ meti na maññati.
sn35.31:1.4.eng: It’s when a mendicant does not conceive anything to be the eye, does not conceive it in the eye, does not conceive it as the eye, and does not conceive that ‘the eye is mine.’

sn35.31:1.5.eng: They don’t conceive anything to be sights …

sn35.31:1.6.pli: cakkhuviññāṇaṃ na maññati, cakkhusamphassaṃ na maññati, yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati.
sn35.31:1.6.eng: eye consciousness … eye contact. And they don’t conceive anything to be the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on eye contact. They don’t conceive it in that, they don’t conceive it as that, and they don’t conceive that ‘that is mine.’

sn35.31:1.7.pli: Yañhi, bhikkhave, maññati, yasmiṃ maññati, yato maññati, yaṃ meti maññati, tato taṃ hoti aññathā.
sn35.31:1.7.eng: For whatever you conceive it to be, whatever you conceive it in, whatever you conceive it as, and whatever you conceive to be ‘mine’: that becomes something else.

sn35.31:1.8.eng: The world is attached to being, taking pleasure only in being, yet it becomes something else.
sn35.31:1.8.comm: Bhava means “existence” or “being”, not “becoming”. Those who are “attached to being” are not attached to “becoming” something else; that would be vibhavataṇhā, “craving for nonexistence”. They are are attached to a state of eternal existence, to continuing to exist in another life (bhavataṇhā). They conceive this to be an eternal self, but their conceiving is ultimately derived from sense experience, which is always changing.

sn35.31:1.9.pli: jivhaṃ na maññati, jivhāya na maññati, jivhāto na maññati, jivhā meti na maññati.
sn35.31:1.9.eng: They don’t conceive anything to be the ear … nose … tongue …

sn35.31:1.11.pli: jivhāviññāṇaṃ na maññati, jivhāsamphassaṃ na maññati.

sn35.31:1.12.pli: Yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati.

sn35.31:1.13.pli: Yañhi, bhikkhave, maññati, yasmiṃ maññati, yato maññati, yaṃ meti maññati, tato taṃ hoti aññathā.

sn35.31:1.15.pli: manaṃ na maññati, manasmiṃ na maññati, manato na maññati, mano meti na maññati.

sn35.31:1.17.pli: manoviññāṇaṃ na maññati, manosamphassaṃ na maññati.

sn35.31:1.18.pli: Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati.
sn35.31:1.18.eng: They don’t conceive anything to be the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on mind contact. They don’t conceive it in that, they don’t conceive it as that, and they don’t conceive that ‘that is mine.’

sn35.31:1.19.pli: Yañhi, bhikkhave, maññati, yasmiṃ maññati, yato maññati, yaṃ meti maññati, tato taṃ hoti aññathā.
sn35.31:1.19.eng: For whatever you conceive it to be, whatever you conceive it in, whatever you conceive it as, and whatever you conceive to be ‘mine’: that becomes something else.

sn35.31:1.20.eng: The world is attached to being, taking pleasure only in being, yet it becomes something else.

sn35.31:1.21.pli: Yāvatā, bhikkhave, khandhadhātuāyatanaṃ tampi na maññati, tasmimpi na maññati, tatopi na maññati, taṃ meti na maññati.
sn35.31:1.21.eng: As far as the aggregates, elements, and sense fields extend, they don’t conceive anything to be that, they don’t conceive it in that, they don’t conceive it as that, and they don’t conceive that ‘that is mine.’

sn35.31:1.22.pli: So evaṃ amaññamāno na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.
sn35.31:1.22.eng: Not conceiving, they don’t grasp at anything in the world.

sn35.31:1.23.pli: Anupādiyaṃ na paritassati. Aparitassaṃ paccattaññeva parinibbāyati.
sn35.31:1.23.eng: Not grasping, they’re not anxious. Not being anxious, they personally become extinguished.

sn35.31:1.24.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
sn35.31:1.24.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’

sn35.31:1.25.pli: Ayaṃ kho sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā”ti.
sn35.31:1.25.eng: This is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all conceiving.”

sn35.32:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all conceiving.

sn35.32:1.3.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā?
sn35.32:1.3.eng: And what is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all conceiving?

sn35.32:2.2.eng: Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”

sn35.32:4.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vā taṃ sukhaṃ vā”ti?
sn35.32:4.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”

sn35.32:6.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ:
sn35.32:6.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus:

sn35.32:6.2.eng: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”

sn35.32:10.1.pli: “Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā”ti?
sn35.32:10.1.eng: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on eye contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”

sn35.32:12.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vā taṃ sukhaṃ vā”ti?
sn35.32:12.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”

sn35.32:14.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ:
sn35.32:14.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus:

sn35.32:14.2.eng: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”

sn35.32:18.4.pli: yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā”ti?

sn35.32:22.1.pli: “Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā”ti?
sn35.32:22.1.eng: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on mind contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”

sn35.32:24.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vā taṃ sukhaṃ vā”ti?
sn35.32:24.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”

sn35.32:26.1.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ:
sn35.32:26.1.eng: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus:

sn35.32:26.2.eng: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”

sn35.32:28.1.pli: “Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi nibbindati, cakkhuviññāṇepi nibbindati, cakkhusamphassepi nibbindati.
sn35.32:28.1.eng: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact.

sn35.32:28.2.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati …pe…
sn35.32:28.2.eng: And they grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on eye contact.

sn35.32:28.3.pli: jivhāyapi nibbindati, rasesupi …pe… yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati …pe….
sn35.32:28.3.eng: They grow disillusioned with the ear … nose … tongue … body …

sn35.32:28.4.pli: Manasmimpi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati, manoviññāṇepi nibbindati, manosamphassepi nibbindati.
sn35.32:28.4.eng: They grow disillusioned with the mind, ideas, mind consciousness, and mind contact.

sn35.32:28.5.pli: Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati.
sn35.32:28.5.eng: And they grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on mind contact.

sn35.32:28.6.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
sn35.32:28.6.eng: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

sn35.32:28.7.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
sn35.32:28.7.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’

sn35.32:28.8.pli: Ayaṃ kho sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā”ti.
sn35.32:28.8.eng: This is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all conceiving.”

sn35.33:0.3.eng: Ten on Liable to Be Reborn, Etc.

sn35.33:1.3.eng: “Mendicants, all is liable to be reborn.

sn35.33:1.4.eng: And what is the all that is liable to be reborn?

sn35.33:1.8.eng: and eye contact are liable to be reborn.

sn35.33:1.9.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi jātidhammaṃ …pe…
sn35.33:1.9.eng: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on eye contact is also liable to be reborn.

sn35.33:1.14.pli: yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi jātidhammaṃ.

sn35.33:1.16.pli: mano jātidhammo, dhammā jātidhammā, manoviññāṇaṃ jātidhammaṃ, manosamphasso jātidhammo.
sn35.33:1.16.eng: The mind, ideas, mind consciousness, and mind contact are liable to be reborn.

sn35.33:1.17.pli: Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi jātidhammaṃ.
sn35.33:1.17.eng: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on mind contact is also liable to be reborn.

sn35.33:1.18.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi … cakkhuviññāṇepi … cakkhusamphassepi …pe…
sn35.33:1.18.eng: Seeing this a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned …

sn35.33:1.19.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.34:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all is liable to grow old. …”

sn35.35:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all is liable to fall sick. …”

sn35.4:1.4.pli: Yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sn35.4:1.4.eng: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’

sn35.4:1.5.comm: “Sounds” are mentioned as “exterior” (bāhya) in Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad 2.4.7, as opposed to the Divinity that has neither interior nor exterior (2.5.19). This anticipates the Buddhist association of bāhira with sense objects. This particular passage is full of echoes with Buddhism.

sn35.4:1.12.pli: Yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sn35.4:1.12.eng: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’

sn35.4:1.13.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpesupi nibbindati, saddesupi nibbindati, gandhesupi nibbindati, rasesupi nibbindati, phoṭṭhabbesupi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati.
sn35.4:1.13.eng: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas.

sn35.4:1.14.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
sn35.4:1.14.eng: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

sn35.4:1.15.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
sn35.4:1.15.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.43:1.4.eng: And what is the all that is impermanent?

sn35.43:1.5.pli: Cakkhu, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ, rūpā aniccā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ, cakkhusamphasso anicco.
sn35.43:1.5.eng: The eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact are impermanent.

sn35.43:1.6.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccaṃ …pe…
sn35.43:1.6.eng: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on eye contact is also impermanent.

sn35.43:1.7.pli: jivhā aniccā, rasā aniccā, jivhāviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ, jivhāsamphasso anicco.

sn35.43:1.8.pli: Yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccaṃ.

sn35.43:1.10.pli: mano anicco, dhammā aniccā, manoviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ, manosamphasso anicco.
sn35.43:1.10.eng: The mind, ideas, mind consciousness, and mind contact are impermanent.

sn35.43:1.11.pli: Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccaṃ.
sn35.43:1.11.eng: The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on mind contact is also impermanent.

sn35.43:1.12.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi nibbindati, cakkhuviññāṇepi nibbindati, cakkhusamphassepi nibbindati.
sn35.43:1.12.eng: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned …

sn35.43:1.13.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati …pe…

sn35.43:1.14.pli: manasmimpi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati, manoviññāṇepi nibbindati, manosamphassepi nibbindati,

sn35.43:1.15.pli: yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati.

sn35.43:1.16.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.

sn35.43:1.17.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
sn35.43:1.17.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.46:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all is to be directly known. …”

sn35.47:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all is to be completely understood. …”

sn35.48:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all is to be given up. …”

sn35.50:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all is to be directly known and completely understood. …”

sn35.5:1.3.pli: yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sn35.5:1.3.eng: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’ …”

sn35.5:1.10.pli: Yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.52:1.1.comm: The root sense of upassaṭṭha (“contaminated”) is something that has been poured upon, or on which something has been let loose (AN 5.192:8.2). Cf. Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad 1.3.6: “They contaminated (upāsṛjan) those gods with evil”, the evil being “unfit” (apratirūpaṁ) sights, sounds, etc.

sn35.52:1.2.eng: And what is the all that is contaminated?

sn35.52:1.3.pli: Cakkhu, bhikkhave, upassaṭṭhaṃ, rūpā upassaṭṭhā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ upassaṭṭhaṃ, cakkhusamphasso upassaṭṭho.
sn35.52:1.3.eng: The eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact are contaminated.

sn35.52:1.4.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi upassaṭṭhaṃ …pe…
sn35.52:1.4.eng: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also contaminated.

sn35.52:1.5.pli: jivhā upassaṭṭhā, rasā upassaṭṭhā, jivhāviññāṇaṃ upassaṭṭhaṃ, jivhāsamphasso upassaṭṭho.

sn35.52:1.6.pli: Yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi upassaṭṭhaṃ.

sn35.52:1.8.pli: mano upassaṭṭho, dhammā upassaṭṭhā, manoviññāṇaṃ upassaṭṭhaṃ, manosamphasso upassaṭṭho.
sn35.52:1.8.eng: The mind, ideas, mind consciousness, and mind contact are contaminated.

sn35.52:1.9.pli: Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi upassaṭṭhaṃ.
sn35.52:1.9.eng: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also contaminated.

sn35.52:1.10.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi nibbindati, cakkhuviññāṇepi nibbindati, cakkhusamphassepi nibbindati.
sn35.52:1.10.eng: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned …

sn35.52:1.11.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati …pe…

sn35.52:1.12.pli: manasmimpi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati, manoviññāṇepi nibbindati, manosamphassepi nibbindati.

sn35.52:1.13.pli: Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati.

sn35.52:1.14.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.

sn35.52:1.15.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
sn35.52:1.15.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.53:1.2.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn35.53:1.2.eng: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

sn35.53:1.3.pli: “kathaṃ nu kho, bhante, jānato kathaṃ passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjatī”ti?
sn35.53:1.3.eng: “Sir, how does one know and see so as to give up ignorance and give rise to knowledge?”

sn35.53:2.1.pli: “Cakkhuṃ kho, bhikkhu, aniccato jānato passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.
sn35.53:2.1.eng: “Mendicant, knowing and seeing the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact as impermanent, ignorance is given up and knowledge arises.

sn35.53:2.2.pli: Rūpe aniccato jānato passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.

sn35.53:2.5.pli: yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccato jānato passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.
sn35.53:2.5.eng: And also knowing and seeing the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on eye contact as impermanent, ignorance is given up and knowledge arises.

sn35.53:2.10.pli: manaṃ aniccato jānato passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.
sn35.53:2.10.eng: Knowing and seeing the mind, ideas, mind consciousness, and mind contact as impermanent, ignorance is given up and knowledge arises.

sn35.53:2.14.pli: yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccato jānato passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.
sn35.53:2.14.eng: And also knowing and seeing the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises dependent on mind contact as impermanent, ignorance is given up and knowledge arises.

sn35.53:2.15.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, jānato evaṃ passato avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjatī”ti.
sn35.53:2.15.eng: That’s how to know and see so as to give up ignorance and give rise to knowledge.”
